CatDescriptText: Mr. George Heitzman, 1729 Eben Street, South Hills area, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 28, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "What do you think of race relations here in Pittsburgh?"  Answer reads: "Pittsburgh is pretty darn good in race relations in comparison with other cities. And I can speak from experience.  During my five years with the Navy I've been to many places in this country and around the world.  And when I speak of race relations, I'm not talking solely about the relations between whites and Negroes, but between all of the races.  Fore instance, the football team which I coach, the Massey Buick team, played the Homewood Scorpions and there were no incidents, just good, hard football and fair play."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of George Heitzman wearing "G" monogrammed handkerchief in breast pocket, standing in front of storefront with sign reading "Zoom"
